controller

Class CalendarController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.CalendarController

  • public class CalendarController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class for the calendar. This class is in charge of connecting EventDAO with CalendarFX, other controllers and GUIs.
    Author:
    Lena, Essi, Tiina

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor to create controller for Calendar without parameters

      Constructor to create controller for Calendar, used in tests

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfEventExist

        public boolean checkIfEventExist(int id)
        Method that checks if the event already exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - - entry/event id
        Returns:
        false if the event doesn't exist in the database already, true if the event is in the database already

      • getCalendarSource

        public com.calendarfx.model.CalendarSource getCalendarSource()
        Method that creates CalendarsSource with calendars. There are 6 calendars created: birthdays, kids, work, borrowed, wishlist and freetime. Each calendar gets its own style, so that they are shown with a different color in the calendar. After the calendars are created, the program reads events from the database for each of the Calendars, converts them into CalendarFX Entries and adds to the calendars in the CalendarSource.
        Returns:
        calendarSource CalendarSource consisting of 6 calendars

      • handleCalendarEvent

        public void handleCalendarEvent(com.calendarfx.model.CalendarEvent evt)
        Method that handles CalendarEvents
        Parameters:
        evt - CalendarEvent - creation, editing or deleting of the event

      • createBirthday

        public boolean createBirthday(java.lang.String name,
                              java.sql.Date birthday)
        Boolean method that gets a String containing Person's name and a Date containing Person's birthday as parameters and creates a database birthday Event. Method first checks if there was a birthday event already. If there was none, a new birthday event is created.
        Parameters:
        name - - String giving the name of the Person/the future title of the birthday event
        birthday - - the date of the Person's birthday
        Returns:
        true - if birthday event was successfully created, false - if creating birthday event didn't succeed

      • updateBirthday

        public boolean updateBirthday(java.lang.String oldName,
                              java.lang.String newName)
        Boolean method that gets two Strings as parameters and updates a database birthday Event
        Parameters:
        oldname - - the old name of the Person/the old title of the birthday event
        newname - - the new name of the Person/the newtitle of the birthday event
        Returns:
        true - if birthday event was successfully updated, false - if updating birthday event didn't succeed

      • updateBirthday

        public boolean updateBirthday(java.lang.String name,
                              java.sql.Date oldDate,
                              java.sql.Date birthday)
        Boolean method that gets two Strings as parameters and updates a database birthday Event. Method first checks if there was a birthday event already. If there was none, a new birthday event is created.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the Person/the title of the birthday event
        oldDate - - the old date of the Person's birthday
        newDate - - the new date of the Person's birthday
        Returns:
        true - if birthday event was successfully updated, false - if updating birthday event didn't succeed

      • updateWishlistDescription

        public boolean updateWishlistDescription(java.lang.String oldDescription,
                                         Item editedItem)
        Boolean method that gets a String containing old Item description and an Item that was updated as parameters and updates a database wishlist Event. Method first checks if there was a wishlist event already.
        Parameters:
        oldDescription - - the name of the Person/the title of the birthday event
        editedItem - - the Item that was edited
        Returns:
        true - if wishlist event was successfully updated, false - if updating wishlist event didn't succeed

      • updateWishlistPerson

        public boolean updateWishlistPerson(java.lang.String oldName,
                                    Item editedItem)
        Boolean method that gets a String containing old name of a person whom an Item was for and an Item that was updated as parameters and updates a database wishlist Event. Method first checks if there was a wishlist event already.
        Parameters:
        oldName - - the old name of the Person that the Item was for
        editedItem - - the Item that was edited
        Returns:
        true - if wishlist event was successfully updated, false - if updating wishlist event didn't succeed

      • updateWishlistDate

        public boolean updateWishlistDate(java.sql.Date oldDate,
                                  Item editedItem)
        Boolean method that gets a Date containing old date when an Item was needed to be bought and an Item that was updated as parameters and updates a database wishlist Event. Method first checks if there was a wishlist event already.
        Parameters:
        oldDate - - the old date when the Item was needed to be bought
        editedItem - - the Item that was edited
        Returns:
        true - if wishlist event was successfully updated, false - if updating wishlist event didn't succeed

        Returns:

      • updateBorrowedDate

        public boolean updateBorrowedDate(BorrowedThing thing)
        Boolean method that gets a Date containing old date when a borrowed thing should be returned and the borrowed thing that was updated as parameters and updates a database borrowed Event. Method first checks if there was a borrowed event already.
        Parameters:
        thing - the borrowed thing that was updated
        Returns:
        true - if borrowed event was successfully updated, false - if updating borrowed event didn't succeed

      • updateBorrowedTitle

        public boolean updateBorrowedTitle(java.lang.String oldTitle,
                                   BorrowedThing thing)
        Boolean method that gets a String containing old borrowed thing's description and the borrowed thing that was updated as parameters and updates a database borrowed Event. Method first checks if there was a borrowed event already.
        Parameters:
        oldTitle - - the old description of the updated borrowed thing
        thing - the borrowed thing that was updated
        Returns:
        true - if borrowed event was successfully updated, false - if updating borrowed event didn't succeed

        oldPerson - the person who is changed
        editedBorrowedThing - the borrowed thing the event and borrower of which are being changed
        Returns:
        updated whether or not the event has been successfully updated

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        event - the right event is returned or null if there was no event
